extendedInfo.description: Transform your Smartphone into a model-specific scuba diving computer!If you are a recreational scuba diver, this is the perfect App to refresh your skills before the dive season resumes, or in-between dive trips.Thanks to our virtual depth sensor you can interact with your Smartphone with simple hand movements and make it descend or ascend in the water column and so create your own dive profile.Tap the compartments icon and see the nitrogen intake and release of your body.And at the end of the dive, tap on the log icon to see a summary of your dive.The iDive Computer App comes with a non branded dive computer, but you can customize it by purchasing, via inApp, simulations for model-specific dive computers of major brands such as Aeris, Cressi, Mares, Oceanic, ScubaPro, SubGear, Suunto and Tusa.The iDive Computer App runs - in real time - our implementation of the Buhlmann ZH-L16C algorithm (moderate conservatism setting) and supports the most typical dive screens such as: surface, normal diving, entering deco, decompression stop, deco violation, fast ascent alarm and post dive.If you are a dive professional this is the perfect App to show a model-specific dive computer in action to your customers and/or students.This App does not support Tablets.This version supports the following model-specific dive computers:Aeris: A100, A300, A300 AI, Atmos AI, Elite T3, Epic, Manta, XR-1, XR-1 Nx and XR-2Cressi: LeonardoHollis: DG05Mares: Puck and Icon HDOceanic: Atom 2, Atom 3.0, B.U.D., Geo, Geo 2.0, OC1, OC1-LE, OCS, Pro Plus 2, Veo 1.0, Veo 2.0, Veo 3.0, Veo 100, Veo 180Nx, Veo 250, VT3 and VT4ScubaPro: Aladin 2G and Galileo SolShearwater: PredatorSubGear: XP10Suunto: Cobra1, Cobra3, D4, D6, D9, Gekko, Vyper, Vyper Air and ZoopTusa: Zen

reviews.title: No point
reviews.comment: At least, none that I can see. I was expecting something that would let me fiddle with the controls on a simulated dive computer, but this app doesn\'t do that. I paid $5.99 for a simulation of my Suunto Cobra, but all this does is show a picture of my computer and simulate a dive. You can control the depth, ascent and descent times, but you can\'t change anything on the image of the computer. And there doesn\'t seem to be any way to get my money back. Save your money on this one.
reviews.author: Rebecca Hoffman

reviews.title: Suck my balls
reviews.comment: I tried to help me bro and our apps looked allright but we found that we gotta pay for sync so to summarise: put me balls in yer mouth and suck \'em you cheapskates
